column4: i just compiled and installed mplayer with vdpau, how do i check to see if it's working
don't seem right
also how can i use it by just double clicking a video, not using terminal
be sure you are using the mpklayer you compiled - not one thats allready installed perhaps.
Found one on sale for like $30 last xmas...  :)
can u point me somewhere?
when in doubt go with the bigger brand/names - not  just somthing thats $5 cheaper.
pricewatch.com perhaps.
the price discrepencies on these things are insane
Im not even using mine at the moment. some of them have  to have drivers taht are not in the normal kernels.  so thats is somthing to watch out for
so its not something that is just PnP?
depends on what kind of 'nas' it is.. The one i had. with the drivers actually appeared as a 'local' disk. I could even run gparted on it.
thats what i'm looking for, do u remember the brand?
Not really 'ndas' perhaps.
it could do USB and nas.  i  had issues using it as nas with some filesystems
its a 'netdisk' by 'ndas'
wireless?
i just found it in a box. :) i wonder what size HD is even in it.
Not wireless.. that would be rather slow.
i dont think its GB wired either..  but id get one now a dasys that was at least a GB lan connection
I dont want wireless, but when i googled NDAS thats all i found
i imagine many can do both.
Im mainy heading toward external sata drives now.
with some fancy scripting.
care to point me in the right direction?
and creative use of the find command.
prolly faster to do it 1 by one then learn how to write bash scripts
yep.  depends on your needs.. you go 10 to do.. or 10,0000
theres some fsck option to answer yes to everything.. (use with caution)
i think its to late
proberly not. hard to tell
in the past ive had to enter the smb://ip#/sharename befor.. for some odd reason to get things to be seen
got this error Error: Failed to mount Windows share
i always fall back tot eh command line to mount some shares.. the gnome file manager is a little weird at times
are you SURE thats a proper share name?
yup...
check with the 'smbtree' and 'findsmb' commands
nautilus mounts them automacally under the .gvfs stuff.. i doub tif its the issue
yep. i see similer issues on windows machines.
what do u think it is
i often edit my /etc/hosts to have the proper ip/machine name. and enable the 'wins' server in my smb.conf  seems to help
i think its windows being stupid really....
I'm not using windows...lol I am using samba but no windows computers on this network
if uysing linux to linux - then NFS will be MUCH faster for file transfers
enable the wins server feature perhaps - may help. and set the hosts file to map ip to hostname perhaps
ive also noticed that some wireless routers block samba shareing
both host and client are connected directly to router...
is the man
hit escape or q perhaps. The keybindings are customuizeable
i recall being able to change the binding in game via the tab key perhaps?
I've searched all over the menu, cant find an option to quit or exit emu
i dont recall it being that hard.  been using make for years.. pretty sure its esc or Q. or q.
lol thats whats so crazy, it should be simple.... I've tried esc, q, all the fkeys every key on my keyboard frankly
i normally use the xmame, not sdlmamne. so could be some keyboard issue/maping issue
xmame is available in repo?
yep - ive used it befor
http://mamedev.org/devwiki/index.php/FAQ:Controls#How_do_I_configure_the_keys.3F
found it, tried it and it works... as usual you solved my problem... you are the man. Thanks :)
you had to hit escape fast or somthnig? :)
i dunno i guess sdlmame keybindings are different, xmame worked. I'm using a UK keyboard atm while configuring the box that could have also contributed to the issue
I'll stick around and try to take care of some low hanging fruit issues with ya... you've helped me so much recently. its the least i can do
I could see where that could break things very badly.
why not a buton to fix 'everything' :)
lol why not?
if contextual search ever pans out, and ubuntu standardizes some stuff and the forums, why wouldnt that be possible?
You would have to find some sort of OS-X mount ssh server as a directory feature.      Or find a scp gui client for OS-X perhaps
perhaps ask in #os-x
You are basically the Mod here right?
Nope. I just dont have a life. Ops live in #ubuntu-ops
lol, well user GLA needs to speak with one of the Wizards
can u help?
ive missed the problem.
test disk is not picking up a drive that is totally screwed up.... Disk Utility does find it but it wont show up in testdisk...any help?? Please!
is there way to tell testdsk to check /dev/sdb for example?
ive not used testdisk enough to even rember its syntax
thats my issue i think...
Looking at testdisk --help -> it can take a 'device'
What fileysstem is the disk anyway?
it doesn't, it doesnt allow me to point to to the location
it's a Scsi NTFS
you are not using /dev/sda when it should be /dev/sda1 ?
the filesystem is so corrupted it wont goto /dev/sda1
or i may have that backwards  may need to be sda instead of sda1
Not sure what else to try. Ive rarely done much disk recovery.
you could try to 'ddrescue' it to a file and try to recover files from that imagefile
ill look into thanks!
it puts stuff in the .wine dir  clean it out start from scratch :)
i've got a bunch of stuff installed, will i have to re-install everything?
for wine.. yep.. depending on what you delete.
you can have seperate .wine directories for diffrent apps if needed
so your saying delete everything in the .wine folder? including drive_c and stuff?
or just move .wine to .wine_old      so you can toy with it
